article.title: Decedent Found on Camino Del Sur Beach Identified as UCSB Student
article.description: There are no obvious signs of foul play. A final cause of death is pending lab results, Calderon said.
article.content:
Police have identified the decedent who was found near the surf line of the Camino Del Sur beach access in Isla Vista.

The decedent, 20-year-old Alessandro Esquivel, was a UC Santa Barbara student, according to the UCSB student directory.

He was going into his sophomore year as a pre-mathematics major.

Esquivel was initially from Downey, California, said Daniel Calderon, Santa Barbara County Sheriff’s Office (SBSO) sergeant.

“It appears he died as a result of injuries sustained from a cliff fall,” said Kelly Hoover, SBSO spokesperson.

The cause and manner of death are pending toxicology and lab results, Hoover said.

His family set up a GoFundMe for funeral costs.

Updated [Oct. 26]: This article was updated to include information about Esquivel’s year and major as well as the GoFundMe information.

Updated [Nov. 19]: This article was updated to include information from Hoover. 

Print
Evelyn Spence

related.title: LIVE: Santa Barbara County Election Results 2018
related.description: The Nexus will be updating this page with live results from the California Primary Election and the Santa Barbara County election.
related.content:
The Nexus will be updating this page with live results from the California Primary Election and the Santa Barbara County election. We will also be live-tweeting additional results.

Further information regarding ballot measures relating to Isla Vista, measures T and R, can be found here and here.

Governor:

Vote by Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: Gavin Newsom leads with 34.47% of the vote

  • 9:20 p.m. Newsom leads with 34.46% of the vote, John H. Cox and Travis Allen follow with 27.00% and 12.86% respectively.
  • 10:30 p.m. Newsom leads with 35.48% of the vote, Cox follows with 25.27%, and Antonio Villaraigosa has overtaken Allen for third place with 11.92% of the vote.
  • As of 11:35 p.m., Newsom wins with 34.03% of the vote in Santa Barbara County. He will be facing off against Cox, who won 26.65% of the vote, in the November election, according to the semi-official election night results.

State Senator:

Vote By Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: Dianne Feinstein leads with 45.51% of the vote.

  • 9:05 p.m. Feinstein leads with 45.51% and James P. Bradley follows with 13.34%.
  • As of 11:35 p.m., Feinstein wins with 45.57% of the vote in Santa Barbara County, according to the semi-official election night results. Her competitor for the November election has not yet been determined.

Congressman:

Vote By Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: Salud Carbajal leads with 52.62% of the vote

  • 9:05 p.m. Carbajal leads with 52.73% of the vote, Justin Fareed follows with 38.22%, and Michael Erin Woody trails with 8.91%.
  • 9:58 p.m. Carbajal leads with 55.62% of the vote, Fareed and Woody follow with 35.86% and 8.39% of the votes.
  • 11:35 p.m. Carbajal earned 54.87% of the vote and Fareed follows with 36.74% of the vote, according to semi-official election night results. The two will be facing off in the November election for the position of U.S. Representative for the 24th District.

Santa Barbara County Sheriff-Coroner:

Vote by Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: Bill Brown leads with 55.94% of the vote, Brian Olmstead and Eddie Hsueh have 31.20% and 12.69% of the votes respectively.

  • 9:05 p.m. Brown leads with 55.89% of the vote, Olmstead has 31.15% of the vote, and Hsueh has 12.79% of the vote.
  • 9:45 p.m. Brown has 55.34% of the vote, Olmstead has 34.49%, and Hsueh has 14.00%.
  • 10:30 p.m. Brown has 54.66% of the vote, Olmstead has 30.07%, and Hsueh has 15.08%.
  • 11:35 p.m. Brown wins with 54.01% of the vote, according to semi-official election night results.

Ballot Measures:

Measure T:

Vote By Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: 76.55% yes, 23.45% no

  • 9:05 p.m. 76.53% yes, 23.47%
  • 11:35 p.m., Measure T passes with 75.73% yes votes and 24.27% no votes.

Measure R:

Vote By Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: 56.34% yes, 43.66% no

  • 9:24 p.m. 71.04% yes, 28.96% no
  • 9:35 p.m. 76.36% yes, 23.64% no
  • 9:45 p.m. 80.22% yes, 19.78% no
  • 9:58 p.m. With 10 out of 10 of Isla Vista’s precincts reporting, Measure R passes with 82.75% yes votes and 17.25% no votes.

related.title: Police Report Possible Sexual Assault in Isla Vista Fraternity House
related.description: A possible sexual assault occurred Saturday night at an unknown fraternity in Isla Vista, the Santa Barbara County Sheriff's Department reported Sunday.
related.content:
A possible sexual assault occurred Saturday night at an unknown fraternity in Isla Vista, the Santa Barbara County Sheriff’s Department reported Sunday.

According to a university crime alert, police received a report at approximately 11:15 p.m. that a female victim had been sexually assaulted in I.V.

The victim told police that she recalled the location of the assault as a fraternity, but did not know the address. The suspect is an unidentified male, according to police.

She also told police that the suspect “potentially drugged” her using at least two different methods before the assault occurred, according to the alert.

The Santa Barbara County Sheriff’s Department and the UC Police Department are both investigating the assault. Anyone with information about the case is encouraged to call 805-681-4171 or use the SB sheriff anonymous tip site.

Print

related.title: Second-Year UCSB Student Passes Away
related.description: Shengyu “Jin” Jin was a second-year physics major in the College of Letters and Science, according to the UCSB Office of Student Life (OSL).
related.content:
A 19-year-old UC Santa Barbara student died on June 6, according to the Santa Barbara County Sheriff’s Office.

Shengyu “Jin” Jin was a second-year physics major in the College of Letters and Science, according to the UCSB Office of Student Life (OSL). Jin was an international student.

His death is the result of a suicide, according to Kelly Hoover, Santa Barbara County Sheriff’s Office (SBSO) spokesperson.

Jin was initially found unresponsive in his vehicle in the 900 block of La Patera Lane in Goleta on June 4, Hoover said in an email.

Paramedics, law enforcement and fire personnel responded and “removed Jin from the vehicle.”

He was transported to the hospital and remained on life support “for several days for organ donation” before passing away on June 6, Hoover said in an email.

Students who are in need of mental health support can contact Counseling and Psychological Services (C.A.P.S.) at caps.sa.ucsb.edu or 805-893-4411.

Print
Evelyn Spence
